item.title: Using userinput and making files
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

Use PHP

[code]<?php
$title = htmlspecialchars($_GET[‘title’]);
$body = htmlspecialchars($_GET[‘body’]);
?>

<?=$title;?> <?=$body;?> [/code]

As for the HTML form:

<form action="thisfile.php" method="get"> Title: <input type="text" name="title" /><br /> Body: <input type="text" name="body" /><br /> <input type="submit" /></form>

GET means the values in a form will be added to the url (eg site.com/file.php?item=value&item2=value2)
The script simply scrubs the input so no XSS can be used and displays it.
